description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5u4p9","text":"We introduce an automated workflow for proximity dependent biotinylation on a liquid handler to process up to 96 samples at a time,combined  with shorter liquid chromatography gradients and data-independent acquisition to increase analysis throughput and enable reproducible protein quantitation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"a75l","text":"Cirri, E., Knaudt, H., Fraia, D. Di, Pömpner, N., Rahnis, N., Heinze, I., Ori, A., \u0026 Dau, T. (2023). Automated workflow for BioID improves reproducibility and identification of protein-protein interactions. BioRxiv, 2023.09.08.556804. https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.09.08.556804","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":235,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F7D63323F77E11EEB85F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.09.08.556804"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jcgf","text":"Cell culture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7sdbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1od1u","text":"●     Day 1: Seed 1.5 Mio cells per P150 plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2foee","text":"●     Day 2: Induce expression of BirA construct by adding Tetracycline 1:1000","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rffq","text":"○     Tetracycline stock: 1 mg/ml in Ethanol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qmvl","text":"●     Day 3: Add 50 µM of Biotin (in water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hfpv","text":"●     Day 4: Collect cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3uol","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n9o7","text":"Collection of cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8j0i7","text":"●     Wash cells 2x with RT PBS + Ca/Mg","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fb8i","text":"●     Add Trypsin and incubate 7 minutes at RT or till cells start to detach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q2nc","text":"●     Add 2x DMEM with 5% FBS and pipet cells carefully off","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehl7b","text":"●     Spin 5 min, 500g at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83car","text":"●     Remove supernatant and","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6nmi","text":"●     Resuspend cells in 10 ml cold PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iool","text":"●     Count the cells (1:5 -1:10 dilution)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu7hu","text":"●     Prepare tubes with 4 Mio cells each","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qoic","text":"●     Spin 5 min, 500g at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"848l9","text":"●     Remove supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cte9","text":"●     Snap freeze samples in liquid nitrogen and store at -20°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33rv6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqrro","text":"Preparing the Lysates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93fmu","text":"●     Resuspend the pellet of 20 Mio cells in 1.25 ml of Lysis buffer in a 15ml falcon tube (scale accordingly to amount of cells)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dupvn","text":"●     Lyse the cells by rotating the falcon tube for 1h, 15rpm at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lnl6","text":"●     Transfer to 1.5 ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es6bh","text":"●     Sonicate the sample 10x 30sec on/off in Bioruptor at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8tlj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bdk5i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g6jc","text":"●     Spin the samples 30min, 4°C, 17000g","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tm8f","text":"●     Keep supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"538gj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9hmkt","text":"No visible aggregates should be there, otherwise sonicate more","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"AD2CC2693F7C4C2C96E0F3E3BA2C5B14"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e8780","text":"2. Acetylation of cartridges (\u003e72 min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14h3i","text":"●      Open pre-set “On-cartridge reaction” under “App library”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"badhl","text":"● ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5efm2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q1vf","text":" collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c42ob","text":"●     Set program ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brm42","text":"■      Volume: 200 µl, Flow Rate: 10 µl/min, Wash Cycles: 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai05a","text":"○     Check “Reaction”: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p7k1","text":"■      Volume: 6µl, Wash cycles: 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckgtd","text":"■      Temperature: 25°C, Duration: 30 min, Reaction Chase: Volume: 100 µl, Flow rate: 10 µl/min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak3eq","text":"○     Check “Cup Wash 1”:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"424ce","text":"■      Volume: 25 µl, Cycles: 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qvcc","text":"○     Check “Internal Cartridge Wash 1”:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h3vr","text":"■      Volume: 200 µl, Flow rate: 20 µl/min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rnic","text":"○     Uncheck everything else","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ivc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"25hon","text":"Stop steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"662ar","text":"Loading of samples (opt.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4eis","text":"●     \nThis is optional and depends on the {"blocks":[{"key":"30v9u","text":"For highly acidic elutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fsrk","text":"●     Speed-vac the samples until dry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51bmr","text":"●     Resuspend in 50 µl of 50 mM HEPES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7npab","text":"●     Check the pH – it needs to be pH 6-8 for Trypsin to work. If not re-buffer with sodium hydroxide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gc0e","text":"●     Add 0.5 µg of trypsin ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ih5f","text":"●     Digest o/n, 37 °C, 500rpm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rhu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e58kn","text":"●     Acidify with 10 % TFA. Check pH, it should be \u003c3, if not add more 10 % TFA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dukbf","text":"●     For both Ambic and ACN elutions, perform OASIS clean up according to manufacturer’s instructions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rh7b","text":"●     Store dried peptides until use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9isgg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ceerg","text":"Proximity dependent biotinylation (BioID) is an important method to study protein-protein interactions in cells, for which an expanding number of applications has been proposed. The laborious and time consuming sample processing has limited project sizes so far. Here, we introduce an automated workflow on a liquid handler to process up to 96 samples at a time. The automation does not only allow higher sample numbers to be processed in parallel, but also improves reproducibility and lowers the minimal sample input. Furthermore, we combined automated sample processing with shorter liquid chromatography gradients and data-independent acquisition to increase analysis throughput  and enable reproducible protein quantitation across a large number of samples. We successfully applied this workflow to optimize the detection of proteasome substrates by proximity-dependent labeling. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Automated BioID sample preparation

creator.name: Emilio Cirri
creator.affiliation: Leibniz Institute on Aging - FLI Jena
